lines.text: Eddie Fisher recently said, "I am sorry. I am sorry for them both." Who was he referring to?
His fans.
Your sheep has a temperature of 102. Is she normal?
People think I'm not normal because I keep taking her temperature.
You're a 71-year-old man who has lost interest in sex. Does your doctor have anything to help you?
No, but his nurse does.
According to Tony Randall, "Every woman I've been intimate with in my life has been..." what?
Bitterly disappointed.
Okay, pick a star.
Steve Landesberg?
I said, pick a star!
Hey!
[audience laughter]
That's okay, I've seen your act!
On what night is a woman most likely to be molested?
With my luck, it's probably tonight - and I'm working.
Your baby has a certain object which he loves to cling to. Should you try to break him of his habit?
Yes. It's daddy's turn.
Say Paul, what is the official currency of Puerto Rico?
Food Stamps.
According to the IRS, out of every 10 Americans audited, how many end up paying more taxes?
Oscar, how's your life?
Well, it's actually miserable
Ohhh.
But I like being miserable; that makes me happy.
It does, doesn't it?
But I don't like being happy, so that makes me miserable.
You're in an airplane and you've developed engine trouble. What do you traditionally say over the radio?
"What the f*ck am I doing here?"
Paul, how many fingers in the girl scout salute?
Gee, I don't remember. The last time I saw it was when I didn't buy their cookies.
Paul, any good sailor knows that when a man falls off a ship you yell 'Man overboard!' What should you shout if a woman falls overboard?
Full speed ahead!
What are "dual-purpose cattle" good for that other cattle aren't?
They give milk... and cookies, but I don't recommend the cookies.
According to Amy Vanderbilt, what is the maximum length of time you and your fiancé should be engaged?
Engaged in what?
Paul, why do Hell's Angels wear leather?
Because chiffon wrinkles too easily.
You're a shy, bashful girl. According to "Cosmo," will you probably be helped in overcoming your shyness by choosing an extroverted, outgoing husband?
Gosh, Pete, I did that once and his wife caught us.
experts say there are only seven or eight things in the world dumber than an ant.
Yes, and I think I voted for six of 'em.
Dennis Weaver, Debbie Reynolds, and Shelley Winters star in the movie "What's The Matter With Helen?" Who plays Helen?
Dennis Weaver. That's why they asked the question.
James Stewart did it over twenty years ago when he was forty-one years old. Now he says it was "one of the best things I ever did." What was it?
Rhonda Fleming.
According to the World Book, is it okay to freeze your persimmons?
No. You should dress warmly.
Little Red Riding Hood was on her way to her grandma's house. On her way there, she stopped to get something for her grandma. To get what?
Feen-a-mints.
According to FEMA, people from Florida should be prepared for hurricanes and people from the Midwest should be prepared for floods. What should people from California be prepared for?
The people from Florida and the people from the Midwest.
Whose motto is "Do Your Best"?
I guess we can rule out Jimmy Carter...
Back in the 1870s, Emile Berliner invented something, and without it, I wouldn't be able to do my job. What was it?
Let's see... toupees? Facelifts? Contact lenses?
Now cut that out!
...Makeup? Capped teeth? Loud sports jackets?
[Sesame Street's Oscar the Grouch is the Secret Square, and the contestant wins it]
Oscar, you've made a man very happy...
I'm sorry to hear that.
In "The Wizard Of Oz", the Tin Man wanted a heart, and the Lion wanted courage. What did the Straw Man want?
He wanted the Tin Man to notice him.
According to columnist Bert Bacharach, people tend to start shrinking a little after age 30.
Did you know that Rose Marie is standing up right now in her cubicle?

[to Paul]
OH, SHUT UP!
True or false, having a good memory is a sign of a well-adjusted personality.
What was the question?
According to the World Book, what is the biggest bird on Earth?
Well, you mean other than me?
Uh-huh. What kind of bird are you by the way?
I'm a lark.

[cracking up]
A lark?
[Audience laughter]

[still laughing]
You certainly are!
[another Secret Square is won courtesy of Oscar the Grouch]
Oscar, aren't you proud again? You've made a woman happy...
No! I'm not supposed to *help* people!
[Oscar groans]
[Big Bird is picked and turns out to be the Secret Square]
Did you ever dream that one day you'd be worth 94 hundred dollars?
Gosh! I was excited about 63 cents!

[describing Oscar the Grouch]
He may be grouchy on the outside, but inside beats a heart of stone.
At a recent hearing, opponents of flourinated water argued that too much flourine in a person's system can cause an uncontrolable desire for sex.

[excitedly]
HEY, CULLIGAN MAN!
Wally, what is the signature phrase of the cartoon character Underdog?
[Cox was voice of Underdog for the duration of the cartoon's airings]
Where are my residuals?
According to Ann Landers, your husband, Edgar, is talking in his sleep. Should you be upset if he talks about his secretary?
And how... his secretary is a guy!
Gee, that's a silly question, Mr. Marshmallow.
Uh, no, Big Bird, that's Marshall, Mr. Marshall.
[Tony Randall has just been asked a question]

[staring dramatically into the camera]
I don't *know*.
[wild audience laughter]
This is a bluffing game! You're supposed to come up with a bluff if you don't know the answer, you silly twerp!
Well, *I'm* sorry...
Is there anything in or on your body that was there the day you were born?

[pointing to her head]
The black bow!
According to the nursery rhyme, "There was an old woman who lived in a shoe. She had so many children she didn't know what to do". What did she give her children to eat?
She lived in a shoe? Filet of sole!
According to the famous children's story, why did Goldilocks refuse the porridge of the great big bear?
Papa Bear?
M-hmm.

[referring to Vincent Price]
Probably Vincent was playing the part, and he cooked it.
Why do people refer to ships as "she?"
Because both have round bottoms.
What is that small cute thing...
Yeah?
[looks down to check his line, but it looks like he is looking at his crotch. The audience and panel erupts into laughter]

[struggling to regain composure]
What is that small cute thing on Cher, just below her waist?
Small cute thing just below Cher's waist?
Yes, what is it?
Sonny Bono.
Why is the booby bird called the booby bird?
Because they have big... feet.
Charley, what do you call a pig that weighs more than 150 pounds?
A divorcee.
Can boys join the Campfire Girls?
Only after lights out.
According to a recent medical study, sex can be harmful to a certain part of the body. Which part?
I'm sorry, what? I couldn't hear the question. A little louder, please?
According to a recent medical study, sex can be harmful to a certain part of the body...
Six? Six can hurt a body? Oh, SEX... I remember. I'll say the eyes because I read about it so much.
Charley, how many balls are on a pool table in a standard game of 8-ball?
How many men are on the table?
In the Shakespearean play "King Lear", King Lear had three of them - Goneril, Cordelia, and Regan? Who were they?
King Lear had Goneril?
When Henry Kissinger recently visited Japan, he went to a geisha house. Now, how did he spend his time in the geisha house?
Oh, negotiating for peace (piece).
Will humming help your tennis game?
Will humming help my tennis game? Sure, why not? It takes your mind off your balls, or something.
True or false, Paul - Gypsy folklore says that God created man by baking him in an oven.

[turns and looks at Leslie Uggams]
Looks like you were overcooked.

[Leslie Uggams laughed so hard she was lying across the desk. She then she got up, walked over to Paul, smacked him on his shoulder, and walked back to her square laughing along with all the stars and the audience]
Rich, what land animal has the largest eyes?

[doing his impersonation of her]
Why, that would be Carol Channing!
What's the one thing you should never do in bed?
Point and laugh!
[the loud horn sounds to signify time running out on the nighttime show]
Let me explain what that means...
Don't look at me!
[reading of the bonus prize after player won the match]
Here's the news, do you ride a bike?

[to contestant]
Do you ride a bike?
[contestant nods]
You do? Good, because in Yugoslavia your prize would be called, "Five thousand American dollars".
[contestant freaks out; Marshall counts off five one-thousand-dollar bills]
Paul, does Ann Landers think there is anything wrong with you if you do your housework in the nude?
No, but I have to be terribly careful when I do my ironing.
What do you like for breakfast?
[Peter Marshall starts to speak]

[sternly]
Don't tell me "grits"!
In baseball, there's a special name for the area between a player's knees and his armpits.

[referring to a certain jingle]
Aren't you glad? Aren't you glad? *Aren't you glad... * he used Dial?
Paul, everyone knows the first verse.
[singing]
What shall we do with the drunken sailor? / What shall we do with the drunken sailor? / What shall we do with the drunken sailor? / Early in the morning? But what is the first line of the next verse?

[singing]
Put him in bed with Elizabeth Taylor / Put him in bed with Elizabeth Taylor / Put him in bed with Elizabeth Taylor / Early in the morning
[audience laughs]
How disgusting... that poor sailor!
True or false, Paul Revere had 16 children?
From *one* midnight ride?
Your date's had a great shock, now she's fainted. According to experts you should loosen her clothing, and do one other thing. What?
Send a postcard requesting an ambulance.
You don't get along with this young lady obviously.
Paul, how do we know the first Union flag was sewn by Betsy Ross?

[in a deep overly-serious voice, singing popular TV jingle of the time]
You look for, the Union Label, when you buy...
True or false, on a recent talk show, Joey Heatherton said, "I am not a sexpot."
She's right, Pete, but you're a damn good emcee.
[show intro]
And here's the master of the Hollywood Squares, Peter Marshall.
Thank you, Kenny and good morning everyone. Nice to have you with us. Hello, stars!
Hello, Peter!
True or false, every day, about 10 million American women take the pill.
And I could name 'em all!
Can you get a closer shave in the morning or in the evening?
I don't know, Peter! I don't shave!
[short pause]
My face, I mean. What a stupid question.
What are "Do It", "I Can Help" and "Can't Get Enough"?
I don't know but it's coming from the next apartment.
True or false, massaging the feet helps some people with hot flashes?
So that's why Rose Marie wears battery-operated shoes.
OH! I KNEW YOU WERE GOING TO SAY THAT! I KNEW IT!
Arthur Hailey had a very successful movie and novel called "Hotel". He has a new best seller about another stopover point. What is it called?
Service Station.
What do most dentists say you should do with your dentures when you go to bed?
Out at the home, we throw them into the center of the room and have a swap party.
